body.p: IASC believed that IAS 36 included sufficient requirements to prevent an enterprise from using assumptions different from the marketplace that are unjustified. For example, an enterprise is required to determine value in use using:

li.p: cash flow projections based on reasonable and supportable assumptions and giving greater weight to external evidence; and
a discount rate that reflects current market assessments of the time value of money and the risks specific to the asset.
